title: Starts running in the background for no reason / Untrustworthy, amateur developers

Next, play a chiptune song in the music player 'Droidsound-E' - when you press Next or Prev song, DuckDuckGo starts running.

Can you clarify what you mean by "starts running in the background"?  The only background task we have (refreshing the stories list) is started when the app is running and the stories fragment is visible. We're conscientious about privacy and resource usage.  Please see github.com/duckduckgo/android for the source code and to contribute if you like

title: Good idea, but the "Orbot" stuff makes it clunky
comment: This used to be just a search engine app, which was great! It's what we needed! Now, however, you have to install an associated app, Orbot, to run data via TOR to use DuckDuckGo. Okay, fine--I don't love the idea of having to install add-ons just to run a basic app, but whatever. Except that Orbot doesn't always work! A lot of websites simply return a "Socks Proxy error" and refuse to load at all. Since DDG won't run without it, that means this app now INSISTS on a component that actually prevents the internet from consistently working properly. I think I'll just uninstall this stuff and use DDG from my desktop instead, where it works without glitches.

This app is actually its own browser - so when you do a search and click on a link, you're not opening a separate program as you do with Google Now. On top it displays news, which is one of the main things I use my phone for, so it has just about everything I need.
